extendedIngredients.name: cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 oz freshly grated cheddar cheese, divided

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 oz freshly grated Monterey Jack Cheese

recipes.title: Salsa con Queso Macaroni and Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile
productMatches.description: A semi-sweet wine of an intense red color. The wine has very fruity aromas and all the grape fragrances can be felt. Lively and fading bubbles are of a marked rose color. Its smoothness makes it surprisingly pleasant, though avoiding excesses. A captivating wine.Apart form being an good companion for traditional cuisinefrom Emilia, it is also indicated as an accompaniment to desserts.

recipes.instructions: Cook the macaroni according to package directions.While the macaroni is cooking, heat the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until melted. Whisk in the flour and cook until the mixture is smooth and liquid-y. Whisk in the milk and ground mustard. Cook, whisking occasionally, until well combined and hot.Whisk in Monterey Jack Cheese until smooth (if necessary, raise the heat on the burner a little to aid the cheese in melting). Add 4 ounces of cheddar cheese and whisk until combined. Taste and season as needed with salt and pepper. Whisk in the salsa. Combine the cooked macaroni and the cheese sauce and pour into an ungreased 9×13-inch glass baking pan. It will be soupy – but don’t worry, the sauce will thicken upon standing and baking. Smooth into one layer.Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese and tortilla chips on top.Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes until hot, bubbly and all the cheese is melted.Serve immediately.

steps.step: Cook the macaroni according to package directions.While the macaroni is cooking, heat the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until melted.
Whisk in the flour and cook until the mixture is smooth and liquid-y.
Whisk in the milk and ground mustard. Cook, whisking occasionally, until well combined and hot.
Whisk in Monterey Jack Cheese until smooth (if necessary, raise the heat on the burner a little to aid the cheese in melting).
Add 4 ounces of cheddar cheese and whisk until combined. Taste and season as needed with salt and pepper.

Combine the cooked macaroni and the cheese sauce and pour into an ungreased 9×13-inch glass baking pan. It will be soupy – but don’t worry, the sauce will thicken upon standing and baking. Smooth into one layer.Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese and tortilla chips on top.
Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes until hot, bubbly and all the cheese is melted.
